remarks: The predicate "is a complex Hilbert space."  A Hilbert space is a Banach space which is also an inner product space, i.e. whose norm satisfies the parallelogram law.  (Contributed by Steve Rodriguez, 28-Apr-2007.) (New usage is discouraged.)
statement: ishlo $p |- ( U e. CHilOLD <-> ( U e. CBan /\ U e. CPreHilOLD ) ) $.
